answers.text: bacteria form a parasitic association with other organisms

qas.question: Can cause for most pathogenic diseases be found soon?

answers.text: may only be discovered many years after

context: If <a0_0>bacteria form a parasitic association with other organisms<a0_0/>, they are classed as pathogens. Pathogenic bacteria are a major cause of <a1_0>human death and disease<a1_0/> and cause infections such as tetanus, typhoid fever, diphtheria, syphilis, cholera, foodborne illness, leprosy and tuberculosis. A pathogenic cause for a known medical disease <a2_0>may only be discovered many years after<a2_0/>, as was the case with Helicobacter pylori and peptic ulcer disease. Bacterial diseases are also important in agriculture, with bacteria causing leaf spot, fire blight and wilts in plants, as well as Johne's disease, mastitis, salmonella and anthrax in farm animals.
